content.question: In 1735 the New York City trial of editor John Peter Zenger helped establish the principle that

choices.label: the government had the right to punish its critics in times of war
legislators had no right to interfere with freedom of the press
an editor could not be punished for seditious libel if the editor’s words were accurate
a defendant was entitled to a trial by jury
the government had no right to censor newspapers

content.answer: an editor could not be punished for seditious libel if the editor’s words were accurate
